greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, T(n,k) = (-1)^k*(2*n)!*P[n,k](n/(n+1)) where P is the P-transform, for n>=0 and 0<=k<=n.
comment: The P-transform is defined in the link. Compare also the Sage and Maple implementations below.
formula: T(n,k) = ((2*n)!/FF(n+k,n))*Sum_{m=0..k}(-1)^(m+k)*C(n+k,n+m)*Stirling1(n+m,m) where FF denotes the falling factorial function.
maple: for n from 0 to 6 do seq(A268438(n,k), k=0..n) od;
# Alternatively, with the function PTrans defined in A269941:
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := (2n)!/FactorialPower[n+k, n] Sum[(-1)^(m+k) Binomial[n+k, n+m] Abs[StirlingS1[n+m, m]], {m, 0, k}];
program: A268438 = lambda n,k: (factorial(2*n)/falling_factorial(n+k,n))*sum((-1)^(m+k)* binomial(n+k,n+m)*stirling_number1(n+m,m) for m in (0..k))
for n in (0..7): print([A268438(n,m) for m in (0..n)])
PtransMatrix(7, lambda n: n/(n+1), lambda n,k: (-1)^k*factorial(2*n))
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Mar 07 2016
